messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Censoring and Monitoring?
messages.msgSnippet: I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it. Voltaire Laura (foolish lover of quotes)
messages.messageBody:
"I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to
say it." Voltaire

Laura (foolish lover of quotes)

messages.messageBody:
"I may not agree with what you say, but will fight for your right to say it"
Always loved that saying!
Tami

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Censoring and Monitoring?
messages.msgSnippet: speak your mind! Johanna Our hunger to be bigger than we are could be just delusions of grandeur or it could be the very voice of God inside calling us to a
messages.messageBody:
speak your mind!
 
Johanna
 
"Our hunger to be bigger than we are could be just delusions of grandeur or it could be the very voice of God inside calling us to a larger inheritance, to a bigger stake in reality, to a truer sense of our identity as the sons and daughters of God." Bruce Larson
----- Original Message -----
From: Helen Hegener
To: Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, April 16, 2001 12:44 AM
Subject: [Unschooling-dotcom] Censoring and Monitoring?

At 12:20 AM +0000 4/16/01, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com wrote:
>    From: "Lynda" <lurine@...>
>Subject: Re: doom and gloom
>
><<<bewg>>>  Pondering the question, will anyone stand up and scream that
>messages such as this are censoring and monitoring?

Good question. <g>

For the record - and the newbies - this is a wide open, no holds
barred list. No censoring or monitoring allowed...

Helen

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/16/01 1:48:24 AM Eastern Daylight Time,
HEM-Editor@... writes:


For the record - and the newbies - this is a wide open, no holds
barred list. No censoring or monitoring allowed...

Helen

That is good to know! :-)

 Tracy-Lynn
Wife to Gary for 15 1/2 years
 Unschooling Mom to 4 sweet boys:
Crisstoffer ~14 1/2, Andru ~13,Wylliam~10 1/2 & Danyel ~9
